In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can achieve this by using the `lowercase` function to convert the string to lower case, then use `replace` function twice. Once to replace all spaces in the column name with hyphens and then again to replace all hyphens with underscores. Here is how you could write such a function:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    col = lowercase(col)                  # convert to lower case
    col = replace(col, ' ' => '-')       # replace spaces with hyphens
    col = replace(col, '-' => '_')       # replace hyphens with underscores
    return col
end
```

You can test the function with any string:

```julia
println(clean_column("My Column"))  # prints "my_column"
```
